newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Brent edges lower in thin trading.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Brent edges lower in thin trading.

text.p: August Brent crude futures were untraded at midday Tuesday, but levels were slightly lower from London's closing prices.
August Brent on SIMEX was quoted $18.65/18.78 per barrel, after London settled 29 cents higher at $18.80.
There was little discussion in Asia, brokers said.
IPE Brent had closed higher on bullish expectations of the American Petroleum Institute (API) figures.
The API figures, released in U.S. late Tuesday saw a drawdown in crude stocks of 4.36 million barrels.
But the rise in heating oil stocks mitigated the bullishness of the crude drawdown, brokers said.
NYMEX last traded at $20.04, down eight cents from New York, where the contract had gained 32 censt to settle at 20.12.
August Brent was last traded at $18.55 per barrel, just
London gapped higher to leave chart-gap support between $18.24 and $18.27. It closed near the highs of the day which has encouraged some follow through buying, traders said.
NYMEX crudes were lightly traded during ACCESS in Asia, with just a handful of lots changing hands. August was last traded at $19.81, up one cent from New York.
